title: What are the issues or problems that Estonia is currently facing? - Quora

response.answer_text: According to the opinions of some average, run-of-the mill Estonians: We´re too small (a nation of 1.3 million people can definitely be considered tiny). Everybody is everybody´s uncle´s ex-wife´s daughter´s classmate´s…somebody. This means lots and lots of of semi-hidden nepotism and people having to be really careful about having and expressing their personal opinions and thoughts (lest there would be backlash).We consider ourselves to be a depressed and negative people (but we find we can blame the “dark season of darkness” that lasts basically from October to April. All kaamos, no hygge makes an Estonian a dull Estonian or something.).We do not feel the sense of belonging together, as people, as a nation. Personally, I´d argue against that - but I´m surrounded by a wonderful, friendly community - and I´ve seen plenty of intelligent, good people being aghast at theirs.Instead of equality, we seem to be heading towards more poverty and inequality, especially concerning vulnerable people (single parents, senior citizens et al.).I´d also like to point out that we´re apparently ranking 1st in the world concerning deaths from drug use, alcohol and hypertension. Being a tiny nation, we really shouldn´t be performing or own rendition of Dumb Ways to Die, but there you are.

There is an interesting Quoresque (read: grotesque) problem in Estonia. I was once told that Chairman Mao had a brief period when he encouraged his colleagues and countrymen to have opinions. Honest criticism was welcome and necessary to make China better. Then the colleagues and countrymen with opinions died. People with opinions aren’t killed in Estonia (I think), but the whole process works like this: Please give us your opinions! We love opinions! People should have more opinions! Let’s participate. Yippiiii!Your opinions are not correct. You have a difficult character. You are a psychopath and a Nazi. You are also weird. Why do you write stuff on Quora? Are you mentally unstable? Go and see someone and take your medication. In a padded cell.So there is no real life Quora in Estonia. I have noticed that most Estonians are quite reluctant to tell other people what they think. They are very smart. They want to avoid unpleasant attacks because their opinions might be wrong.
